clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Trial of Carbon-ion Radiotherapy Combined With GM-CSF for the Treatment of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Phase II Single-institution Trial of Carbon-ion Radiotherapy Combined With Granulocyte-macrophage Colony-stimulating Factor for the Treatment of Hepatocellular Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this research project is to assess the efficacy and toxicity of hypofractionated carbon-ion radiotherapy with concurrent granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor for the treatment of hepatocellular carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock: Golden E.B. et al.in 2015 reported that localized radiotherapy granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) produced objective abscopal responses in solid tumor with metastasises. We hypothesize that hypofractionated carbon-ion radiotherapy combining granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) might improve the clinical response rate and progression-free survival (PFS) in hepatocellular carcinoma. The primary endpoint of the current phase II trial is progression-free survival rate at 2 years, secondary endpoints are overall survival, safety and toxicity.

primary_outcome.description: Time in months measured from treatment initiation until the date of progression or the date of last follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: Time in months measured from treatment initiation until the date of death or the date of last follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time interval from the start of carbon-ion radiotherapy to 3 months after the completion of carbon-ion radiotherapy]

arm_group.description: Hypofractionated carbon-ion radiotherapy was prescribed at a dose of 40Gray(Gy) [relative biological effectiveness (RBE)] in 5 fractions for intrahepatic cases away from gastro-intestinal (GI) tract (>1cm) with concurrent GM-CSF 125ug/m2/d, subcutaneous injection d1-28;

intervention.description: Hypofractionated carbon-ion radiotherapy was prescribed at a dose of 40Gy RBE in 5 fractions
